nl.cwi.java_managed_data.language.schema.load

Class SchemaLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.cwi.java_managed_data.language.schema.load.SchemaLoader

  • public class SchemaLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Dynamically loads schemas. This is where the whole loading process is done, given Schema definition (interface), this class provides an instance of this schema.
    Author:
    Theologos Zacharopoulos

    • Nested Class Summary

      Helper private class to keep Fields with their Method which define them.

      Helper private class to keep Types with their Classes which define them.

    • Method Detail

      • bootLoad

        public static Schema bootLoad()
        Bootstraps the schema schema
        Returns:
        The instance of SchemaSchema

      • setupCacheForSchemaKlass

        private static void setupCacheForSchemaKlass(SchemaFactory schemaFactory,
                                             java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> schemaKlassesDef)
        This is a special case. Since every Managed data has a schemaKlass, which means that during the loading of managed objects (e.g. Point), we need an already created Klass that would used in the schemaKlass field definition. However, if the Klass schema definition has not been given as input in schemaKlassesDef, then the schema loader will never created, and we will have an error. Thus, we check if the Klass definition is given in schemaKlassesDef, and if not, then we can the Klass definition from the schemaSchema itself.
        Parameters:
        schemaKlassesDef - the schemas definitions (interfaces) to be converted.

      • load

        public static Schema load(SchemaFactory factory,
                          java.lang.Class<?>... schemaKlassesDef)
        Convert from a schema definitions (interface) to an instance of Schema.
        Parameters:
        factory - the factory which creates the schema
        schemaKlassesDef - the schemas definitions (interfaces) to be converted.
        Returns:
        the instance of Schema

      • wireFieldTypeKeys

        private static void wireFieldTypeKeys(java.util.Map<Type,SchemaLoader.TypeWithClass> types)
        From all the created types that are type of Klass, get their field and set as key the first field found as KEY. We dont need that for primitives since it is done during the type assignment.
        Parameters:
        types - all the created types

      • buildFieldsFromMethods

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Field> buildFieldsFromMethods(java.lang.String klassName,
                                                                           SchemaFactory factory,
                                                                           java.lang.Class<?> schemaKlassDefinition,
                                                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SchemaLoader.FieldWithMethod> allFieldsWithReturnType)
        Build fields from given methods
        Parameters:
        klassName - the name of the klass that the fields are belong to
        factory - the schema factory
        schemaKlassDefinition - the Class of the klass
        allFieldsWithReturnType - all created fields
        Returns:
        all the fields of a klass.

      • wireFieldTypes

        private static void wireFieldTypes(SchemaFactory factory,
                                   Schema schema,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SchemaLoader.FieldWithMethod> allFieldsWithReturnType)
        For all the fields created, set the real types of the field. The trick here is that in case of multi value (many), the type is not the collection but but the Generic Return Type which we can take via reflection.
        Parameters:
        factory - the schema factory
        schema - the schema
        allFieldsWithReturnType - all the created fields

      • wireFieldInverse

        private static void wireFieldInverse(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SchemaLoader.FieldWithMethod> allFieldsWithReturnType)
        Wire the inverse fields.
        Parameters:
        allFieldsWithReturnType - all the created fields
